response_parsed.title: Optimizing REST APIs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to leverage FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+, to optimize your REST APIs for improved efficiency and performance.
key_points: FastAPI is designed with productivity, usability, and performance in mind
It features automatic documentation, type checking, and easy integration with other Python libraries
FastAPI provides a powerful set of tools to optimize APIs, including caching, middleware, dependency injection, and more
The performance gains from using FastAPI stem from its focus on asynchronous execution, efficient handling of HTTP requests, and intelligent usage of Python 3.12+ features

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import Depends, FastAPI, HTTPException
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from models import MyModel
app = FastAPI()
session = Session(bind=engine)
def get_mymodel(session: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    return session.query(Mymodel).first()

version_notes: FastAPI is compatible with Python 3.7+, but to take full advantage of performance optimizations and other features unique to Python 3.12+, it's recommended to use the latest version.
Python 3.12+ brings enhancements to type hinting, context variables, async/await, and more, all of which contribute to the efficiency and productivity of FastAPI development.
caveats: FastAPI requires a suitable database library (such as SQLAlchemy) for connecting to your database
Though FastAPI is designed with performance in mind, it's crucial to follow best practices for API design, such as keeping routes simple and focused, and properly handling errors and edge cases.
